@colken16 Another excellent German film about Second World War is Sophie Scholl. Das Boot is quite possibly the best WW2 film ever made. It’s important to get a view of Germany’s experience, after all, the winners always write history as they say. That is not fair, or right.

Just belatedly seen Hunter Killer (2018) movie. Not great…borrows heavily from other better submarine films: Hunt for Red October (1990), Run Silent Run Deep (1958), We Dive at Dawn (1943) and original TV series Das Boot.

@colken16 Clint Eastwood’s pair of companion films: Flags of Our Fathers and Letters from Iwo Jima, telling the battle of Iwo Jima from the perspectives of the US and the Japanese. The 1976 version of Midway. And my favourite 1998 German film Das Boot
@colken16 Stalingrad and/or Das Boot

@colken16 Any from 12 O'Clock High, Das Boot, Battle of Britain, Dunkirk (original has edge on Nolan's version), Bridge at Remagan, A Bridge too Far, Downfall, Empire of the Sun. 

Recently The Pianist, To End All Wars, Flowers of War, while Midway makes up for abominable Pearl Harbour.

@colken16 The movie Stalingrad - made by the same people as Das Boot - tells an important part of the story of the Eastern Front.
And, not a movie, but the BBC R4 dramatisation of Len Deighton’s ‘Bomber’.  Particularly if you stay up all night, and listen to it, as broadcast in real time.
@colken16 Don't know how old he is but perhaps Saving Private Ryan, Downfall, Fury. Stalingrad, Das Boot, Only Old Men are going into Battle

@colken16 ‘The Captain’ (Der Hauptmann); The Longest Day; The Battle of Britain; Das Boot; Saving Pvt Ryan;

@colken16 Watch a few minutes of any British WW2 film made between 1939-1945 and point out the main protagonist is a lowly foot soldier. Watch a little of one made in the 50s and point out the lead role is an officer.

Far fewer German war films but Downfall and Das Boot are actually good.
Anyway. Just got Das Boot from Steam. Looking forward to sinking many ships 👍

@DragonTaria You need context and a narrative story to bequeath such an honorific. U-96 in Das Boot is a Hero ship. It's all about the story. Same goes for the villains. My commentary mostly applies in the fiction sense. I wouldn't feel right trying to apply this to history.

@colken16 Empire of the Sun (was going to say Das Boot but already been mentioned). This has taken me back to studying WW1 at school & watching All Quiet On The Western Front. Absolutely howled through it. As i do with most war films 😩
